731697f-a.title: Feast of Saint Augustine.
731697f-a.text:
Shrine to St. Augustine at 89 Elizabeth Street during Feast in
his honor.
August 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

721770f-a.text:
Mott Street, at the N.W. corner of Hester Street. Also shown is Hester Street, west from Mott, to and including Centre Streets.
August 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
721770f-a.folder: Mott Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY

720421f-a.text:
172 Hester Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Mott Street.
Building concerned is a 4-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 527
720421f-a.folder: Hester Street & Mott Street, Manhattan, NY

732465f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments.
732465f-a.text:
Vendor, of soft-drinks perhaps, on Hester near Mott Street, using a
converted baby carriage for conveyance.
August 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

Dr. Kung-Chuan Chi, editor-in-chief of the Chins Daily News, a Chinese language paper published in New York City. China Daily
News is located at 105 Mott Street.
1940
Alexander Alland

paper business anywhere.

732231f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 2.
732231f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 2
Dr. Chi, editor-in-chief of the China Daily News, was formerly Commissioner of Education and Dean of Law at the University of
Shansi Province.
1940
Alexander Alland

732249f-a.text:

732250f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 21.
732250f.text:
Newspapere: China Daily News Series--No. 21 This Chinese newsboy contentedly counts his papers, calmed down with the photographer's discarded flash bulb.
1940
Alexander Alland

732251f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 22.
732251f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 22
The ancient abacus, called 'suan pon," is still used in Chinese business offices in preference to modern adding machines.
1940
Alexander Alland

732252f-a.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 23.
732252f-a.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 23
"Moi Hua," sturdy winter blooming tree adopted by the Chinese people as representative of the spirit of New China. This picture of "Moi Hua," by a famous Chinesspainter, Chang Hsin, who now resides in this country, can be seen in the business office of the
China Daily News.
1940
Alexander Alland

732253f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 24.
732253f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series--No. 24 Mother reads the latest news from China to her hhildren. The China Daily News also features fine short stories.
1940
Alexander Alland

732232f.text:

Constance Hong, a Columbia graduate, sometimes pinch-hits as secretary to her husband, publisher of the China Daily News.
1940
Alexander Alland

732235f.title: Newspapers - China Daily News Series No. 6.
732235f.text:
Newspapers: China Daily News Series---No. 6 Mr. Moy, City Editor, has a witty column of his own in the China Daily News, titled, 'I write As I Please."

Alexander Alland
